newsitem.title: GERMANY: Kolbenschmidt agrees Chinese piston JV.
newsitem.headline: Kolbenschmidt agrees Chinese piston JV.

text.p: German components group Kolbenschmidt AG said on Wednesday that it had agreed a joint venture with China's Shanghai Piston Works (SPW) in Shanghai.

Kolbenschmidt would take 35 percent of the joint group and German development agency Deutsche Entwicklungsgesellschaft (DEG) will take 15 percent, it said. Kolbenschmidt had an option to purchase the DEG stake after five years.

The remaining 50 percent would be held by car maker Shanghai Automotive Corporation (SAC) besitzen, which currently holds 100 percent of SPW, the firm which will form the basis of the joint venture operation.

Kolbenschmidt said that of the 1,000 workers currently employed by SPW, 750 would be transferred to work for the joint venture company, which would operate under the name Kolbenschmidt Shanghai Pistons.
The joint venture group would have an annual sales volume of 40 million marks.
